item.title: [Allstar]Interface
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Ill make a complete command for you when I get home.

EDIT: You want to use arguments instead of sub strings.

String[] args = command.split(" ");

And then simply add the args of the int.

showInterface(args[1]);

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]Interface
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

[quote=“xX4m4zingXx, post:6, topic:527760”]i made it working!
i now got:

if (command.startsWith("si") && (playerRights == 3)) { try { int interfaceID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(3, 8)); showInterface(interfaceID); //int interfaceID = inStream.readUnsignedWordA(); } catch (Exception e) { sendMessage("Perhaps you typed something wrong."); } }

but i want that if you want the number 139 that you don’t have to type 00139[/quote]
check this right now ^

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]Interface
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

is it possible to make a command to open an interface.
i have already tried something:

if (command.startsWith("si") && (playerRights == 3)) { try { int interfaceID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(3, 8)); //int interfaceID = inStream.readUnsignedWordA(); } catch (Exception e) { sendMessage("Perhaps you typed something wrong."); } }
